intro: Briquetiastrum, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Bombacaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and features showy, flame-colored flowers that bloom in clusters. The plants are characterized by their large, palmate leaves and produce capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Briquetiastrum species are often cultivated for their ornamental value due to their striking floral display. They thrive in warm, humid climates and are adapted to various soil types.
